content:
Miguel Raz Guzm√°n Macedo said:

Mexico City, Mexico / UNAM

Opening new thread "Mexico City, Mexico" (you posted in the Boston thread).
Aqui andamos!
Alright tomorrow is this post's :birthday: and I'm still the only one around here, but now starting with Lean4. Vengaaaa!
¬°Hola!
I'm from Monterrey, but will be moving to Guanajuato in a few weeks
Good luck. Greetings from Guadalajara.
@sir Cris
Hola desde Cuernavaca! :wave:
Hola!
Hola desde Ciudad de M√©xico!
Al fin hice "Functional Programming in Lean4", parece que ya est√° todo lindo para entrarle otra vez :D

Hola desde la Facultad de Ciencias de la UNAM.
Nuestro grupo es peque√±o pero intentaremos reunirnos para seguir aprendiendo. Si les interesa nos podemos poner de acuerdo para leer algo o hacer algo en Lean
Yo tambi√©n soy de M√©xico.
Nuestra peque√±a comunidad crece :slight_smile:
@Luis Turcio ¬°Hola! ¬øtienen reuniones en l√≠nea? estoy en GDL.
Nadie ha organizado nada que yo sepa, pero estar√≠a genial hacer algo :slight_smile:

Hasta hace un par de semestres hab√≠a un seminario, organizado por Lourdes Gonz√°lez de la facultad de ciencias de la UNAM, para aprender Lean. No s√© si este semestre vaya a continuar. En ese seminario tambi√©n hab√≠a gente conectada por Zoom
Tal vez podr√≠amos aprovechar que aqu√≠ hay entusiasmo para organizar algo

Please note this website is English speaking only. We do tolerate a couple of words in other languages in this specific channel when greeting people. But please do not start actual public conversations in non-English languages. Don‚Äôt worry: broken English like my French version of English is totally fine, this is not an English literature contest :wink:

Patrick Massot said:

Please note this website is English speaking only.

Is there precedent or a rule in writing for this?

I can understand the concern for more general discussion, but to require people who live in a Spanish-speaking country to discuss congregating in English seems like an unnecessary burden.
The maintainers still need to be able to enforce the code of conduct and rules of the zulip
Maybe the diplomatic solution is to make some other Spanish-speaking place of discussion?
Well there's a Discord for Lean which is less strict https://discord.gg/WZ9bs9UCvx, you could ask for a Spanish channel

Justin, if you want precedent you can browse all other threads in this channel to see they use (the international version of) English. I don‚Äôt remember whether we have it listed as an explicit rule somewhere (it‚Äôs hard to list all the obvious things in those rules).

Ruben Van de Velde said:

The maintainers still need to be able to enforce the code of conduct and rules of the zulip

This is not written anywhere, as far as I am aware.

Patrick Massot said:

precedent you can browse all other threads in this channel to see they use (the international version of) English.

I meant precedent for explicitly requiring people to speak in English with the goal of meeting up to discuss Lean in countries where English is not the primary language.

Over 99% of the people living in Mexico City speak Spanish, whereas only ~10% speak English.
I'm not sure what you're trying to accomplish with the rules lawyering
yes

Luis Turcio said:

Tal vez podr√≠amos aprovechar que aqu√≠ hay entusiasmo para organizar algo

That'dbe cool yesh

Luis Turcio said:

No s√© si este semestre vaya a continuar.

is there an email list or something I can join in case it does? thx

Ruben Van de Velde said:

The maintainers still need to be able to enforce the code of conduct and rules of the zulip

Oh I think I didn't get what you meant at first. In order to know whether the rules are being broken or not, moderators need to understand what is being said. Didn't occur to me. Excellent point.
